text: in the middle of the winter the last
thing I wanted a holiday party is an ice
cold cocktail I've got something to warm
me up so I like to make a warm rum punch
it's festive it's delicious
and you know what you can even set it on
fire this particular rum punch dates
back to keep NZ and times in fact it's
Charles Dickens recipe I got it from my
friend Dave Wondrich who is a cocktail
historian and he wrote a book called
punch so he knows what he's talking
about the only thing I did was I changed
it up in the original recipe it calls
for all lemons I also added some
tangerine peel just to make it tangerine
II I'm going to add one more lemon peel
I'm using Demerara sugar which is raw
sugar and now you're gonna muddle it to
get those citrus juices into the sugar
what I'm making right now is called an
oleo saccharum and if you can you should
make this either the day before or at
least three hours before you want to
serve the punch the oils kind of leach
into the sugar everything becomes
perfumed and you have a lot of great
flavor so it's been three hours no not
really but we did a swap out this is the
part of the punch that you want to do
when everyone is at your party
gather them all around and tell them
what you're doing and I'm going to take
some cognac use good but not the best
cognac because you're gonna mix it
cognac adds smoothness and body as my
friend Dave says this is Amber rum you
can use any kind of amber rum if you
want to set this on fire
you need to find overproof rum because
it helps it flame up better so I have
some Jamaican 100 proof rum a couple of
notes about fire safety if you do want
to set this on fire first of all make
sure you use a fireproof Bowl this is a
very heavy ceramic ball metal or a
silver bowl will work well don't use a
glass bowl trust me I've done it and
your bowl will break why did it was a
mess
and then after everybody's gone
whoo-whoo cuz they will then you just do
this and then this is gonna put out the
flame
and now I'm gonna finish the punch so I
have some tangerine juice lemon juice
and then you want to add hot or boiling
water and then that's it your punch is
done people are gonna be lining up for
it so be ready to serve it
Oh
